definition: hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
line of business/industry/occupation/job/employment/school studies/enterprise/property/(Buddhism) karma/deed/to engage in/already

sentences.english: The owner-peasants and the master handicraftsmen are both engaged in small-scale production.
sentences.chinese: 自耕农和手工业主所经营的，都是小生产的经济。

sentences.english: Industry and trade with foreign countries became prosperous, woolen cloth was on sale in European countries.
sentences.chinese: 城市手工业和对外贸易都相当繁盛，呢绒行销欧洲。

sentences.english: New Year picture of Wuqiang was a kind of handcraft.
sentences.chinese: 武强年画业是手工业发展的一个类型。

sentences.english: Their position is similar to that of the handicraftsmen.
sentences.chinese: 他们的地位类似手工业者。

sentences.english: Traditionally, American medicine has been largely a cottage industry.
sentences.chinese: 传统上，美国医药界主要是家庭手工业。

sentences.english: Revived handicrafts that have no fear of being beaten down by the influx of machine-made goods from abroad.
sentences.chinese: 因为手工业复兴了，不怕被机制洋货的倾销挤倒了。
这些都是手工业制造的商品。

sentences.english: Soviet industries, when I visited Red China , were all handicraft.
sentences.chinese: 在我访问红色中国的时候，苏区工业都是手工业。

sentences.english: Reserve time for your favorite cooking or crafts projects.
sentences.chinese: 为您最喜爱的烹饪或手工业项目留点时间。

sentences.english: Suzhou silk handicraft has a long history, and through much of it the Yunjin Guild was its guild organization.
sentences.chinese: 苏州丝织手工业历史悠久，云锦公所为其行会组织。

sentences.english: We have developed a new cottage industry.
sentences.chinese: 我们已经逐渐形成了新的家庭手工业。

sentences.english: The same goes for an individual crafts person who gets paid on a per piece basis.
sentences.chinese: 同样的道理也适用于按件计酬的单个手工业者。

sentences.english: As a kind of typical traditional handicraft industries, Hui ink industry also had to be reconstructed.
sentences.chinese: 作为典型的传统手工业，徽墨业也不能例外。

definition: natural economy (exchange of goods by bartering not involving money)
